intro: Verbascum vanense, commonly known as the Vanese mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are broad and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Verbascum vanense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
